org.jetel.data.primitive

Class ByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.primitive.ByteArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.Iterable

    public class ByteArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.Iterable
    A class that represents dynamic array of bytes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int count
      The count is the number of byte used.
      protected boolean dataCompressed
      The value is/isn't in packed form.

      The value is used for byte storage.

    • Method Detail

      • ensureCapacity

        public final void ensureCapacity(int minimumCapacity)
        Ensures that the capacity is at least equal to the specified minimum. If the current capacity is less than the argument, then a new internal array is allocated with greater capacity. The new capacity is the larger of:
        • The minimumCapacity argument.
        • Twice the old capacity, plus 2.
        If the minimumCapacity argument is nonpositive, this method takes no action and simply returns.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - the minimum desired capacity.

        public void encodeBitStringAppend(java.lang.CharSequence seq,
                         char bitChar,
                         boolean bitValue)
        Appends bit sequence like string "010011" into byte array.
        Parameters:
        seq - character sequence that is converted to the internal byte array.
        bitChar - represents true or false value
        bitValue - tells what bitChar value is (true or false)

      • decodePackLong

        public long decodePackLong()
        Converts a byte array containing a packed dicimal number to "long"
        Returns:
        long number
        Throws:
        BadDataFormatException - input is not packed decimal format or number would not fit in long
